pullrequest.title: Generic physics parameters in Gazebo and SDF

content.raw:
I do think that this is not yet an exhaustive list, but I don't think these fields should be repeated.

My thought is that the fields of `Any` should reflect the possible types in SDF, which I believe are: `double`, `int`, `string`, `Vector3`, `bool`, `color`, `Pose`, `quaternion`, `time`, `vector2i`, `vector2d`. I don't think that it's possible for an SDF leaf element to contain a repeated field in this way. An SDF element might have multiple attributes, but each of these attributes maps a name to a key. So I think it makes sense for `Physics` and maybe `Joint` to have a repeated `Param` field, and `Param` messages should have a repeated `Param` field to reflect how SDF elements can have multiple children (or attributes).
content.html:
I do think that this is not yet an exhaustive list, but I don't think these fields should be repeated.

My thought is that the fields of Any should reflect the possible types in SDF, which I believe are: double, int, string, Vector3, bool, color, Pose, quaternion, time, vector2i, vector2d. I don't think that it's possible for an SDF leaf element to contain a repeated field in this way. An SDF element might have multiple attributes, but each of these attributes maps a name to a key. So I think it makes sense for Physics and maybe Joint to have a repeated Param field, and Param messages should have a repeated Param field to reflect how SDF elements can have multiple children (or attributes).
